description:
Nipe Story (Tell Me A Story)  is a fortnightly Kenyan podcast that gives a voice to written short stories.  This podcast is hosted by Kevin Mwachiro. @kevmwachiro
Karibu! Welcome.

items.content: Remember the proverb, 'Until lions have their own historians, tales of the hunt shall always glorify the hunter.'  Here's an episode that brings this proverb to life.

items.title: THEATRE MASKS by Dennis Mugaa

items.content: We probably all have come across a Shakewell in our lives. The  smooth talker, the guy who always knows about a good deal and is always up to make a quick buck or two. That buck usually comes at your expense.   The question is, is there any good in them?

items.title: MY MIDDLE NAME IS TRUST by Ntsika Kota

items.content:
After the Credits Roll is inspired by the documentary film I Am Samuel  - the true story of  Samuel Imbaya, a Kenyan man torn between duty to his family and honesty about his sexuality and identity.  

After the Credits Roll is an original production by We are not the machine Ltd. Visit www.watchiamsamuel.org to learn about the true story behind this audio drama.

items.title: MISSING by Isabella Matambanadzo

items.content: Adanna Okoro is her name, she is a beautiful woman with a past. A past that is tied to a family tragedy that changed her home. And yet there is her own story, one she cannot share publicly. And then there is Okechukwu, our eyes into Adanna, the Okoros and life and how it can change unexpectedly.
